str2: A tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation. Apparently akin to skeuos and skia; a tent or cloth hut.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of skeuos; to prepare thoroughly; by implication, to construct, create.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably contracted from tessares and peze; a table or stool, usually for food; also a counter for money.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From protithemai; a setting forth, i.e. proposal; specially, the show-bread as exposed before God.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
